review: Had lunch here for their sneak peek before the official grand opening. Was greeted right away by the manager and hostess. We were seated in the bar section. When all the tables are full with customers it's just a little tight to walk around. Cookie Magic Milkshake was good. Ordered the Ensenada Chicken Platter. The chicken was cooked great, juicy with lots of flavor. The servers were very attentive and quick with any requests. They also were very knowledgeable and answered all questions about the menu. Great first experience and I will be returning to check out their Happy Hour.

Sometimes the burger joint should just be a burger joint service was great food was horrible. I would not go back again to this restaurant. The other reviews that were put on here must've been by employees

The 5 start are for service and atmosphere not the food since we did not get to eat it. I'll explain. Sunday Dec 1 was my 2nd visit to Red Robin and my BF's 3rd. It was not packed so we sat at one of the high tops at the bar and were served relatively quickly by Susie (very nice) so we ordered our pints (ice cold) and the Honest Hummus with carrots, cucumbers and potatoes kettle chips app.  The app came out with bone dry and ashy carrots and soggy chips; there always seems to be a lot of floor managers just roaming so I called one over and Gary was kind enough to remove the app and request a rush on a new order (no problem).  Approximately 18mins later Gary the manager is told by the kitchen manager that they are out of hummus, NOT GOOD. Gary apologized profusely and we placed our dinner order of burgers and fries.  OK! The burgers came out and my sweet fries were cold, my burger was cold and not at all how I ordered it and my BF's crispy chicken was also not how he ordered it and his fries were raw.   Again, we called Gary over and again he was very apologetic.  We told him we understood how things can happen but that we would not be ordering food at that time. He was very nice and actually pleasant just as our server Susie was.  He was not at all happy with the food prep and even gave us our pints at no charge for the ridiculousness and weird inconvenience.  Thank you Gary Blum, manager.

RED ROBIN - YUM! I think this chain is a nice addition to the mall. Yummy burgers, friendly and patient! I was with a group of 5 - 4 adults and 1 child. 3 of the 4 adults (excluding myself of course) had many questions and needy creations with their meals. Our waitress was very helpful with helping our picky eaters pick out a good burger.  I had the Whiskey River BBQ Burger - it was scrumptious. Everyone was pleased with their choices and we left very full. Only negative was within 2 hours that burger killed my esophagus and I was stuck with some serious heartburn for the rest of the night :(  I def plan to come back and try a different burger soon!

Our family ate here today for lunch and it was great. The waitress was awesome her name was Jamie L and she was probably the best waitress we ever had anywhere. She knew everything and helped us pick out what to order, she kept coming back to the table to make sure we had everything and she cleared off our table as more things came. You don't get that any more. The food was great and I love the fires they have.

My husband and I went here on wed the 8th of Jan. we sat at the bar...didn't want to wait. I do not drink alcohol so I ordered a coke...the barmaid looked at me like I had 3 heads...I wish she could have seen my thought bubble! Has she heard of AA? Anyway my husband had a drink and she seemed happier with him. We ordered our dinner which was good. She never checked on us once the food was delivered...never offered us ketsup, salt ect. I had to ask for those. I had to ask for napkins..my husband glass sat their empty during his meal until he called her over again.  Needless to say, my coke was empty 1/2 way thru the meal and never refilled. By the way, we were the only ones sitting at the bar the entire time...that should have given us a hint!  She simply didn't care..which is too bad. I used to wait tables and I am an EXCELLENT tipper.  I am sorry I don't have her name but she was sporting a "snookie" hairstyle!  We left and raced home because we both ended up in our bathrooms for a better part of the night! We will NOT be back!  A shame because we both work and eat out a lot!

This is only the second Red Robin I have visited, the other was in IL.  I really thought that this location does it well.  It was a bigger store and had a slightly larger menu.  Plus, the server recommend some good beers for the local area.  The food was good and well done.  Red Robin is doing well.  Plus, they have many different freebies when you join their loyalty program.  We tried the fish and chips and the roast beef dip sandwiches during this visit.  All good.

Negativity is not good, and I do not like to write about it, but when something is not good well you need to speak up about it.  The other day I was in the Danbury area so I thought to stopped by and have dinner.  It took 15 minutes before I had my drink served, and it took another 20 minutes for the right food to  arrive.  Apparently first time I was given another customers order.  Almost forgot that the for the second drink I had to wait another 15 minutes.  The food was very much undercooked, I guess they were in a hurry to make up for the mistake.  Overall D-.

Went here for lunch today with my boyfriend, first time at a Red Robin for both of us. Food was okay, a little more fast food-like than my expectations. Waiter and staff were friendly but service was awful. We sat in the bar area, the drinks took forever to come out, food wasn't very hot and the menu was a little confusing. Overall, I would visit again but definitely not first pick.

I went here a couple of months ago, my first time actually, I ordered a veggie burger on a gluten free bun and a wedge salad, my burger was beyond well done, kinda burnt, the wedge salad was good, I could've made a better salad at home, and my garlic cheese fries were pretty darn good. The prices are reasonable, I will definitely go back again.

We took our two toddlers here tonight around 5pm for an early dinner, and had a really great experience.  No wait.  The hostess & server were both extremely welcoming and accommodating of the kids.  It's a small thing, but our sever saw to warming up my little one's cup of milk...completely AWESOME.  Thank you Alyson!  I also really appreciated the healthy choices on the kids menu (my girls had the grilled chicken bits & steamed broccoli).  I had the crispy chicken tender salad, which was quite fresh & good, and my husband had a burger & fries.  I also really enjoyed my margarita.  The balloons at the exit made our night.  Seriously, it was a great experience for all of us.  And quite affordable, $50 ticket for all that.  We'll be back. Nov, 2014:  Went back with a huge party of 11 people, including 5 kids, and had a wonderful experience.  Thanks!!!

Stopped in for a mid afternoon Sunday lunch, wait was about fifteen minutes and we were seated in that time frame. The place was kind of busy and our waitress was at the table right away to take a drink and food order. Our soda's arrived quickly but it took quite a while for our food to arrive, which is strange given that it really is only a burger joint, nothing fancy on the menu just burgers and sandwich type stuff. I know it's not McDonalds fast, fast food, but things should have moved along a lot quicker, they need to really work on this. The food was ok as burgers go, nothing special just middle of the road. The fries were tasteless, maybe a hint of freezer burn and the onion rings dripped oil, lots of oil. For the two of us with no apps, soda and two burgers it was forty bucks with tip. I'd put that on the pricey side for burgers. Will I go back, probably not, I can eat the same at five guys for half the money and quarter the time. Seems like the place is more about the show and less about the go. Sorry, Red Robbin, but it takes more than yum to get it done.

Terrible restaurant...the server wasn't bad but we didn't get our drinks for a long time, about 20 minutes. Our order took about 45 minutes for 2 burgers, 1 veggie burger and pretzel bites. The manager was bitching to his employees about a disgruntled table in front of our table. He also walked by a busser who clearly needed help after dropping silverware with his hands full. The floor at the main entrance was buckled due to a flood in the dish room. There was no warning sign, it was only covered by a mat. If someone were to trip the manager would be screwed with a lawsuit. I would never go back nor recommend anyone to go. Being in the restaurant industry for 10 years it has to be one of the worst experiences I have ever had.
Yummmm great burgers and Fries. My girlfriend gets the chicken sandwiches and she says those are great.onion rings are good too. I also tried their milkshakes and that was good as well.

I give this two stars because the kitchen took FOREVER to deliver the food.  When we went it wasn't too busy (no wait, maybe half the tables full).   Appetizer came quickly, then we began the nearly 45 minute wait for entrees.  Server walked past our table a few times during this time while our food was M.I.A. and you'd think that he would realize we were still waiting for food when he looked at us, but now of course I wouldn't be writing this if it was the case.  After we finally flagged him down, he went to check on the food and said it would be out in just a couple minutes.  Another ten minutes later, we asked him for the check and he said he would check on the food one more time and finally came out with the food.  No apology, no goodwill gesture for all the time we spent waiting.   Overall, food is standard chain burger joint fare, a little pricey but the service was subpar.  Because of the lack of service and wait time, I won't be going back.

Probably the best burgers for a chain restaurant in Danbury. The BGR Place is great for a quick burger at the mall, but this Red Robin has a custom restaurant atmosphere that makes you feel like you're not I'm the mall. I have eaten in the bar area twice, and each time I have received good service with a smile. The blue ribbon burger is great, and the smoke and pepper burger was even better. I want to try all of the burgers, but moderation is advised, because something that tastes that good can't be good for you.

We were a party of six and waited for 15 mins which is fine. We've waited longer so I'm fine with that. We were seated and it took about 5 mins before our drink and appetizer order was taken. Drinks and appetizer came out. We ordered our entrees and then we sat and sat and sat. Our drinks weren't refilled and we were there for an hour with still no food in front of us. I left 25 bucks and left. What a disappointing visit.

2 stars would be extremely generous but other than the friendly hostess and a decent atmosphere, our dining experience was pretty bad. As stated by many others, don't expect for your food to come out without a loooong wait! Even with the place being at less than half capacity! I wouldn't mind waiting a bit for good food but the food (when It finally arrived) was beyond awful! I had the French dip sandwich. It was the worst I have EVER had!!! It was tiny, there was barely any meat and the meat that was in there was so dry, cold, and tasteless that if it wasn't for the au jus dipping sauce, I would not have taken a second bite! The edges of the meat sticking out beyond the "mini" French roll were rock solid and the horseradish sauce was so dried into the bread underneath that it was showing cracks! The menu advertised it being served with caramelized onions, I think there were a few in there somewhere. Then there were the sides... I'd comment on the taste of the coleslaw but the dollop was so minuscule that I didn't have enough for that third deciding bite. The only thing that was pretty good were the sweet potato fries despite a few of them being soggy. Then I hear a server announce to the table behind us that they're out of onion rings. Really? At 1pm on a Sunday? Shame on the people that run this place!!! If I wasn't trying to show a good example to my kids, I'd have called over the manager which I never do! It was that bad! I hope the manager or some corporate exec that gives a crap about this place is reading this and all the other reviews and makes a change. I'm rooting for this place to succeed and don't remember having such an awful dining experience in other Red Robin location. Get your act together and fast! There were too many things wrong with my last visit and many other's writing reviews to be an isolated fluke!

Atrocious! I know it's a chain so this review doesn't hold to much weight but the food was aweful the wait staff was dripping in sweat all over the food and our waitress forgot about us for over an hour!!! Two thumbs down!

The app for time until seated was great especially with the hour wait. Burger was much smaller than expected and underwhelming. Fries were very good. Service was friendly but slow. Manager had to come to two tables near us to resolve problems with unhappy customers and food. Expensive for a slow average meal.
Located in the Danbury Fair mall, so keep that in mind when you're trying to find the place.  Came here for lunch & got good service, food, etc.  I'd come back.

While I do like the fact that it is in the mall and you can get a decent burger and cold beer I have to say that on this last visit we continue to be under-whelmed with the place. And now that they are the one of the few in mall burger game (Ruby Tuesday now closed) places I have to say the food is becoming very SYSCO food service or US Food Service standard fare. I have beed a Red Robin fan since the mid 80's when I had my first Red Robin burger in San Leandro, CA. Since that time (and it has been 30 years) there has been a steady decline from high quality burgers that are perfectly cooked to what has to be pre-formed frozen patties. Don't get me wrong, its not unacceptable fare just not spectacular. Still a decent "in the mall" kind of place but nothing memorable. 3 Stars is all I can give it.

I've been to red robin on other locations. This was a bad experience from the beginning. Waitstaff took forever, nobody checked on us after food was served.  My salad was limp and missing the grilled chicken. No crackers or activities for small children. Service was verrrry slow. Manager walked passed table several times without asking how things were as I was waiting to ask where my chicken was for my salsas. Even after we complained we waited 15 minuted for a check. I would not recommend this place for anything but a drink.

The food was okay but the fries we're ice cold and the barbecue wrap had no barbecue sauce on it and the service was so slow and terrible.  "Bottomless" steak fries don't exist since the server never brought us more when we asked.  And the 2 managers were on their phones the whole time and drinking milk shakes while the 3 servers we're sprinting around the restaurant.  Save your time and money and go the Asian restaurant next door.
All three of us were sick after eating there. Will not return for any reason. How can you screw up a plain chicken sandwich?
Awful. Little flies all over, 1-1/2 hour wait for mediocre burger and inedible salad.... Never again!

The server was very nice and the manager was nice too as he walked around the restaurant apologizing to all the hungry, eyes glazed over patrons because their food was taking so long to be served. 40 minutes to be exact from the time we ordered. I wanted to eat the napkin. The people at the table next to us ordered more "bottomless fries" and had to ask a second time for them 20 minutes later and then 10 minutes later were told they would be out soon. I'm sorry but if you are going to offer "bottomless fries" on your menu, you should have a bin of them ready to go at all times. This was my second visit. The first was only slightly better. I won't be back. If you're hungry go elsewhere.

This was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Let me explain why. First, on a night that wasn't very busy, we waited about 40 minutes for our food to arrive. When the meals did arrive, we had to ask for napkins from a different waitress who seemed bothered that she had to get them for us. The worst part was that there was a good chance our food had been sitting out for some time because both meals came out cold. Our waiter never came by to ask how everything was, he only stopped by to collect our plates. To top it off, the staff was looking to close the main entrance so we were asked to leave because we were seated near the door. This place has extremely poor service and mediocre food. I would not recommend eating at this location.

We've been here three times - awesome burgers! But the service is so slow that each time we had to ask to speak with the manager. One visit we went for lunch at noon and left at 1:30. 1.5 hours for a burger? On our last and final visit, we waited 20 minutes, no one ever came to the table. We left and went to the food court.  It seems there aren't enough servers and cooks. It's a shame because we really liked the burgers here.

Food is very good...if and when you ever get it! Last night was the last straw. It was the third time now that the service was so mind numbingly slow that we had to get up and leave. It was the final time we would wait and every time it ruined our meal,experience. The food is delicious, and the captive audience frequenting the mall will keep their seats full. But be aware that you will walk away sated but so angered that you just spent 2.5 hours of your life getting that burger.

We had the luxury of sitting right next to the kitchen to watch them get completely weeded during a Sunday afternoon lunch. Rachel, the expo, clearly didn't know what she was doing. Lunches were sitting in the window for long periods of time. Salads sat under the heat lamps for over 10 minutes! Our burgers, which were supposed to be medium, came out well most likely due to sitting under those lamps for a while. She was repeatedly yelled at for calling runners and sending food to the wrong table. We watched another table complain because their food was an hour and fifteen minutes in the making. We were appalled when the white haired manager on duty rolled his eyes and called the patron a bitch to the busser as he walked away from the table. We would give our server Jason 5 stars if it weren't for all of this. He did his best in a terrible situation.

I ate at this restaurant on Sunday. The service was extremely slow and it wasnt that busy. They messed up my boyfriends burger order TWICE and it was a simple order, our waiter came by very little so i asked another waiter for the free refill ok our ice teas and he never brought it to us and completely forgot about it, the manger apologized about the burger but doesn't comp us anything. Then the manager brought us the  check and we gave him the credit card and he walked around the restaurant with it saying he couldn't process it,the waiter needed to....ummm weird. Not recommending this place to anyone, go to 5 guys instead!

Went there for lunch, wait time was minimal. Food was average. My waiter was attentive to our needs and very friendly. He stated we were his first customers of the day. An hour later he asked if we were all done, because he needed to punch out. Apparently, when the wait staff have no customers in their section they are required to punch out! He left his previous job because red robin promised full time work. Well it's not full time if your staff have to punch out during their shift. I'm not a waitress, nor have I ever been, but I think this is a terrible way to treat employees. This company will never be able to hold on to good waiters/ waitresses because of this policy. There are so many places to eat in Danbury, I will take my business to restaurants that treat there employees fairly.

My burger was tasty and juicy, however medium rare (my preference) is not an option.  I did enjoy what I ate.  The fries were good too.  The side dish, French onion soup was less than adequate. It had a soggy unappetizing piece of bread under the cheese and very little actual onion. They should call it onion broth. On top of that it was served with a teaspoon instead of a soup spoon so it took a long time to even get through half. My burger arrived while I wasn't even halfway done.  My dates salad could only be called that in the abstract sense. A very large chunk of iceberg lettuce on a plate with some bacon and fried onions on top isn't much of a salad. Guess he was supposed to slice and toss it himself.   Our server was very friendly, but a tad distracted. This was both of ours first visit to a Red Robin. It will probably also be our last.

Ugh, was so excited for Red Robin to arrive, but definitely a disappointment.  Food is terrible and cold.  I had a chicken wrap and the chicken was raw in the middle.  The manager denied this was possible because the chicken comes in cooked already.  Well, thanks for that, but it's raw!
The food was good and the server was pleasant. No complaints. They did a nice job accommodating our twins and stroller.

yuuuummmmmm I grew up eating red robin so coming to one of these places tastes like home.  I was in the Danbury area and spotted the red robin and had to go! I was greeted by a hostess who wasn't amazingly friendly. No biggy. I was told my wait time would be 15 minutes. It turned out to be 3 minutes.  We waited about 15 minutes for someone to take our order. Once we had the initial meeting with our waitress she was excellent and absolutely went the extra mile.They gave my pregnant wife a free order of onion rings to apologize for the wait. That won some major points.  The size of the portions has gotten smaller in the last few years.  Overall I love the food and will return.

Service is very slow. I hope they were short a few employees but I don't think so. There were tables near us that needed to be cleaned. The waiting time was 20 minutes. Not impressed with the food today.

I've been here a handful of times because I am a fan of the burgers. The service is terribly slow, every time we've waited forever for our order to be taken then even longer for our food to arrive. This past time we went, they took our name and amount of people and texted us when a table was ready for us which was about a 25 minute wait. I told the host I would like a booster seat and highchair for my baby and toddler. We were first sat right by the doorway to the kitchen and after sitting down waiting for them to bring our highchair we were told we needed to be moved somewhere else because of fire hazard and we couldn't have a high chair there . No big deal, but I did mention to the hostess I needed a highchair so I'm not sure why we were put somewhere they knew there couldn't be a highchair. Food was good so no complaints there, but the waitress made a rude comment to us after our food came about my "poor baby not getting anything to eat", she's 7 months old. Maybe just a harmless joke but unprofessional nonetheless. Not sure if we'll return again.

Gourmet burgers are the specialty of the house... and they are flavorful... but service is excruciatingly slow and food was not hot. I think they forgot about us and everything sat waiting for pickup until it was almost room temperature.
I've never tried red robins until this one opened in Danbury. Love the turkey burger and sweet potato fries. Service was fast and friendly each visit.

It has come to my attention that this is my 100th review.  Since 2011 I've been giving you nothing but the straight truth and useful tips.  My reviews and insights are relied upon by thousands....perhaps tens of thousands of people. I can't believe it's been 100 reviews.  What a ride!  (actually it should be more: a few got yanked.  Such as one I did for a restaurant called "Hemispheres" in which I reviewed the Rush album from the 1970s.  The owners apparently did NOT like that.  And a writeup I did for a certain feminist restaurant in Norwalk got pulled for being too "sexist".  Or something. ) But on to the current review: 5 stars for helping you weed out the over-priced, overhyped ripoff spots.  I maintain my title: Champion of the Cheap. 5 stars for standing up against price gougers and calling out rude waitstaff who suck at their jobs. 5 stars for my review of Cafe Tavolini, I which I took on the persona of Chef Gordon Ramsey.  You loved that one and voted hard with the funny button. 5 stars for repeatedly calling B.S. on establishments with horrible parking like Costco Norwalk and Trader Joe's Stamford. 5 stars for the "Yelp Exclusive" expose in which we uncovered an erroneous receipt with "bad tipper" printed on it.  (Empire Szechuan)  5 stars for my legendary review of the Cheaters gentleman's club in Cocoa Beach, Florida. Throughout it all, nothing makes me happier than seeing a big CLOSED next to names of places I gave a 1-star review.  Justice served. And yes, just like Red Robin Gourmet Burgers, I will always give you unlimited fries and soft drink refills.

Great menu, big selection/plenty of choices.  Also very Gluten free friendly.  Servers are very nice and knowledgable of the menu. Last time I was there, my server expressed an honest interest in what I wanted to eat, answered all my questions  and made great recommendations. Good portions, the food was hot and fresh - especially the fries ( bottom-less fries definitely a plus!)  If you are a burger person, definitely give this restaurant a try.

Everyone has seen the Red Robin commercials... REDDDD ROBIN YUM! ;-)  When we found out that there was one in our mall we gad to go! The first few times we tried to go on a Friday/Saturday night... there was a wait and I'm impatient. We finally went during a week night and were seated almost immediately. The hostess looked bored... but our waiter was great. The menu is overwhelming... pages upon pages of burgers. We have now been 3 times and I always get a  specialty double tavern burger (I like thin, well-cooked burgers). Delicious! My son had a barbecue burger... it was good he said. We have had the boneless wings with the pineapple barbecue sauce... I'm not usually a sweet-salty girl but it was delicious! The best part of this chain is the bottomless fries and drinks! The fries are delicious! If only the waiters/waitresses were good about offering refills on the drinks/fries! By the time we find our waiter/waitresses we are frustrated... make sure you ask well before you run out!  Next time we go I want to try the onion rings.

Our waiter was friendly and he did a great job serving us. On the contrary the rest of the staff seemed very lazy and were chatting in groups lounging on customer dining tables, some hooked onto their cellphones. One of the waitresses even changed out her work apron and put on her regular off work clothes/ jacket right in front of us. This results in poor ambiance and I'd recommend the management fix this issue. Not meant to be a negative review but I genuinely think this would help! Food was great!

After encountering several let downs at this restaurant due to poor customer service, we decided to try again after several months. Walked in to our seating area observing tables which had not been cleared, and upon sitting for 10 minutes without so much as a drink order, we simply got up and left. Sad that there's no proper management running this location as it's a nice atmosphere.

Been there twice. Both times we waited a really long time for a burger and two kids meals.  Food was decent but the service sooo slow. On the second visit the waitress dropped my kid's chicken and she didn't get her food until the rest of us were done eating. The waitress was nice to comp us the child's meal but waiting one hour for some pieces of chicken on a stick is ridiculous. Won't be going back.

We made our fourth visit to this location for dinner tonight - it was after the mall was closed, but the restaurant was still open. It was nice to not have to wait, and it was relatively quiet other than one unhappy infant on the other side of the wall.  At this point, we pretty much have standing orders... I like the Southern Charm burger - no bun, and the husband likes the Royal Red Robin burger with a lettuce wrapper. My favorite includes cheddar, brown sugar bacon, lettuce, tomato and a sweet barbecue sauce. His comes with a fried egg, bacon, american cheese, lettuce and tomato. We each choose to indulge in the onion rings rather than the bottomless fries - they are well worth it! Crispy, panko crusted golden rings of yumminess! It's a must to forgo the traditional ketchup and ask for a side of the Campfire Sauce to dip them in. We have yet to be disappointed in the food here. We typically opt for unsweetened iced tea, but tonight I tried one of their new summer drinks - the Strawberry Lemon Vojito - Strawberry Lemon Vojito - billed as "Mojito's long-lost cousin. Made with Absolut Citron® vodka, Minute Maid® Lemonade, mint, strawberries and club soda." It was refreshing, not too sweet, and I'd definitely get it again!  Our servers have always been polite and attentive, without being overwhelming. This place is not around the corner for us, and we choose to take the ride when the burger (and onion ring!!) craving strikes. The only reason I gave 4 not 5 stars is that one of the tables nearby us sat dirty with dishes piled on it for almost our entire meal. With it being so quiet, there was no excuse for it to sit that was for so long.

2.5/5 This Red Robin is conveniently located in the Danbury Fair Mall near the parking garage. The servers are very friendly, caring, and nice people. Unfortunately, the management isn't great though. The food and drinks are below average.

We have been here on multiple occasions and we haven't had a bad experience yet. The one star deduction is for every time I've gotten a grilled chicken sandwich rather than a burger is because it seems undercooked and quite tough/rubbery. With that being said- stick to the burgers. I hate french fries but they have other things that are bottomless. If you're trying to eat healthy you can forgo a bun and wrap it in lettuce or just the burger in general. Plus you can get bottomless steamed broccoli or bottomless fruit salad.  If you like strawberries get the freckled lemonade. Plus .10cents from every freckled lemonade purchased is donated to Alex's Lemonade Stand in the fight against childhood cancers.  I would go during the weekday.  We made the mistake of going to Danbury the night of the fireworks so it was kind of crowded and the women's room bathroom was out of toilet paper.

Every time I've eaten here the service has been so slow.Gave it some time and tried again when not busy and no wait for a table,again very slow and table next to us had food come out first,when ours came out the kids meal was burnt(mini corn dogs).Would not recommend especially if eating with children unless you want a long wait!

I haven't in recent memory been to such a f@$king horrible establishment, the proprietor should be totally ashamed and the manager in charge should be sacked! So lets start the list, dust everywhere on moldings, tables and furnishings, Dirty black plate that clearly was not washed maybe rinsed, Asked for burger to be pink got gray dried out shit, Ice cold sweet potato fries, $1.99 entertainment fee, on way out reported how bad things were and manager just shrugged, $65 dollars including tip for what?. In times where money is tight how can RED ROBIN in Danbury suck the life out of eating out by having such total lack of respect for the families that come in. Never been so disappointed in my entire life. Oh I forgot to tell you that me beer glass was so dirty I could scrape the stuff inside off! I want my money back and an apology from these jerks.

Everyone's burger was cooked the same way, well done. They were all ordered medium or medium rare. I'm not sure why they bother taking temperatures.  The service was ok, manager was very friendly.  I don't think we'll be back. A bit expensive for food quality.

If I could give it no stars I would! Run away from this place ! Service was horrible and food was even worse, dried up burgers and cold fries. We waited an hour for our bad food and just ate it because we were on the way home from a late night and starving really.

Red robin:  I don't know how it stays in business. One hour wait when 50 empty tables/- most of which are not cleared from previous customers. Ince you are seated, takes forever to be served.  I'll never go back! Needs new management

Service was slow and impersonal. Don't get me wrong, the host was interested... in cat calling the girls walking past my family in the mall.  Mind you, after ordering drinks and appetizers there was a lengthy wait for 2 waters, a kids juice, and 2 coffees.  Although the server, Matt, warned us it'd be a wait since he'd  be brewing a fresh pot, ours came from another server and were frigid.  The wait for our dinner was ridiculous, made even worse by Matt informing us well after 25 minutes that ingedients were sold out... and then we waited another while longer even without any changes! I spoke with the shift manager, who had strategically propped herself with a lemonade by the dining room, who lied to say she'd seen the tray ready and our food was coming right out.  Matt, you were tireless and pleasant.  Kudos! Management, your priorities suck, your service is patheyic, and your competencies in managing a team are seriously lacking if you think shooting a customer ugly looks during dinner is at all appropriate.  I don't typically rate restaurants on faults, being a chef, but management and her miserable attitude coupled with her weak ability to handle her crew made this meal... in a time where half the dining room was empty... a truly negative experience.

Pretty bad for a Red Robin. I've eaten at several of the chains before and have always had a pleasant time, even during rush hour for food. Today though, stood out in particular for being awful. It was busy, but not lucrative for the day after Christmas. Red flags popped up as soon as the hostess had no idea where to seat us (a party of two) despite passing by 3-4 open 2-person booths. They wanted us in the bar, but no thanks. So we were sat in a booth next to the bathroom.  Red Robin has those new tablet-esque things at the tables, but a waiter comes by regardless to get drink orders, place entree orders, ask if you want more fries, etc. We waited in our booth for 10-15 minutes and not a single one of the 3-4 waiters stopped by. Not one even glanced at us! Like I said, this place was busy but I've seen it more packed on a regular Friday night at a bigger mall. If I'm gonna pay $13 for a hamburger, I want good service. I certainly don't want to sit next to  the bathrooms and be ignored by the waiters.  Eventually, we just deserted our menus and left.

My family had a terrible experience at this Red Robin the night before Thanksgiving.    Normally we love Red Robin's so were excited that there was one along our travelling route we could stop at for dinner.  Although we saw plenty of empty tables and no one waiting, we were told there was a 25 minute wait (should have been our first clue to change our plans).  They were able to take a phone number to text us when our table was ready, which was convenient, so we went upstairs to let the kid ride the carousel.  Half an hour later we got a text, just as we were on our way down to find out what the hold up was.  We were seated and quickly placed our order for our child's meal and our drinks, then shortly after ordered our two adult entrees.  The kid's meal and drinks came out in a little while and then... nothing.   We waited and waited.  The waitress was... off somehow.  Very strange demeanor and hovered at our table too long after each interaction.    She passed our table several times during this period and made some unprofessional remarks like loudly saying "I just don't know what their problem is back there!" and "Sorry about the wait but it's not MY fault".   Finally she came by again and announced that the kitchen had 'lost the ticket" and she had to put the order in again.   Our daughter was now almost done with her meal and it was getting very late.  The waitress suggested we talk to the manager, but when he came over he gave the most non-apology response ever: "It's a computer problem.  I've told the IT guy."   No apology, totally blamed it on someone else when he as the manager is ultimately responsible.  We said this was unacceptable and to cancel our order as we really needed to get going and he said they would have it ready in 2 minutes are we sure we don't want to take it to go rather than go hungry?   We hesitated but then said OK.   Moments later they did produce a to-go bag.... and a check including the two entrees we waited an hour for.   Apparently the manager had a very different understanding of our conversation than we did.   By cajoling us into accepting the to-go order he thought it was fine to still charge us for it like nothing had gone wrong.    I stepped outside with my daughter at this point and my husband again spoke to the manager (after another wait) and eventually emerged having paid only the waitresses' tip.   Another one of the "new" Red Robin locations that's not the same as the old style ones we love like the West Hartford location.   Not sure if they over-expanded or what but there is definitely a management problem going on between this and the Milford locations!

Me and my cousin went to this red robin right before New Year's Eve. We go there a lot and always love it but this time... NO. There are so many reasons why it was so bad it's NOT even funny. My first reason why is that the the service was HORRIBLE. The order was wrong and the wait took an hour, since they messed up the order. My little cousin had broccoli and I asked for more to one person, it never came. Second, na. Third and finally came. So we waited on hour just for broccoli. If they had good service, it would have came at the first of second time. But the third, not good. And we ordered salad and they were all out at like 8:00. How can you be out already when people start flooding in at 8:30. People will want salad at that time. And I ordered a burger and it took half an hour just to bring my right burger. Can these people hear. If I ever go back it's a different one. So if you are looking to go here either tell them to get better service, or go somewhere else like BGR. That's also in the mall. So thanks for reading and Dom is out.

I really wanted to like this place unfortunately we have been there twice  Disappointing  I had a stale bun and undercooked burger The second time my wife had a overcooked burger on a stale bun A " Gourmet " burger joint with stale bread and can't cook a burger ?!? It is fairly new I may return and give it a try in a few years  hopefully they will have it figured out by then

I love a good burger, and this place will provide plenty of options towards that. A huge problem I had was the waitress her finger nail was so dirty on underneath that it reminded me of a melted dead oreo. Do you guys wash hands there ? Stay away and go to Rossy's tomorrow, and try their lobster burger instead its much better.

I see my prior review of the Danbury, CT Red Robin restaurant was not posted so I will post it again. I rarely complain about poor dining experiences.  However, I feel compelled to complain about a recent dining experience at the Red Robin restaurant located at the Danbury, CT mall. My family has eaten at two dozen or so different Red Robin restaurants over the past ten years. We have always been quite satisfied with the quality of the food and the quality of the service at these Red Robin restaurants......until eating at the Danbury Mall Red Robin restaurant! Food wait time and restaurant cleanliness was very poor.  Three other families had problems with their food orders and wait time as did we.  Based on the many negative reviews of this restaurant over the past 1-2 years, it is clearly obvious this Red Robin restaurant has SERIOUS management problems that need to be immediately corrected by Corporate Red Robin. This poorly managed Red Robin restaurant is giving all of the many other well managed Red Robin restaurants a "big black eye". Red Robin must be losing a ton of future repeat business from the many disgruntled dining customers who have dined at this Red Robin restaurant over the past year or so.  This also has to be giving the Red Robin Corporation some serious bad press.  I will not re-visit this restaurant nor can I presently recommend this restaurant to friends/family that live in the Danbury, CT area.  I provided my disappointing dining experience feedback to the Red Robin Danbury mall restaurant before leaving the restaurant. I am sure my feedback was completely ignored by the restaurant manager as evidenced the MANY negative reviews by other customers who visited this same restaurant following my 9/30/15 restaurant visit.  I see the same problems continue!  I also sent an email to Corporate Red Robin informing them about my family's poor dining experience at this restaurant.  I suggest everyone who takes the time to write and post a negative review about this restaurant on YELP also take a few additional minutes send a copy of their same negative review to Corporate Red Robin.  Go to the Red Robin website, click "Guest Support", and Click "Restaurant Feedback".  Copy and paste your negative review here.  Mention the fact you have also posted your negative review on the the national YELP website. Maybe Corporate Red Robin will take some serious, corrective action if more people directly complain to Corporate Red Robin about this poorly managed corporate owned or franchised owned restaurant.  "United We Stand!"

Just visited for dinner tonight.  Food is good, but the service at this location has a lot of room to improve.  It took the waitress a solid 15min to get to our table after we were seated.  When the food was finally delivered, she never asked if we wanted more drinks or needed anything more.  In fact, she ran off before I could ask.  By the time she came back, we were all done w/ our burgers.  Nice enough lady, just not solid service.  Been here several times and this is sadly a consistent story.

I had gone tonight because I had a gift card and with high hopes because people have said it was good. 5 minute wait which wasn't bad. However, it took 10 minutes for someone just to take our drink order, 15 more minutes for them to come, and 25 minutes for out appetizer, and 30 minutes for the entree. The burger was charred and dry. The fries were eh, and the rings were pretty good. Overall would come back.

Indifferent service, unbelievably slow with no explanation. On a Wednesday evening at 7 PM it shouldn't take more than half an hour for food to come! The lighting is uncomfortably bright over the tables... The table was offkilter I at least an inch and rocked back-and-forth so badly I had to ask for another table. Very unimpressed and will never come back

Save your time and money and go elsewhere, this place has awful service.  Waited 20+ minute for a table.  I was told when I asked for an update that I had been texted 15 minutes earlier and when I didn't show up they had cleared my name from the list.  I showed the less than polite hostess that I had never received the follow up text and she said it was my phone's problem. Was told I would have to wait again while they found a table. Having small children who wanted this for lunch is the only thing that prevented me from leaving.  When we were finally seated, the place was half empty.  What a joke.  Our waitress only showed up twice.  Once when I hit the call for server button the table top touch screen thing and again when she then returned to our bring food.  I suppose she was handling the rush of half empty tables.   Food was mediocre, but I knew what I was getting into so that was fine.  Kids had a blast at least

This is not the first time I've been to Red Robbin and my first experience was very pleasant. The service was great and so was the food. Today I went back and I was disappointed. It took 30 minutes for the food to come out. My wrap was cold & and one of the wraps did not have chicken. Our waiter was very attentive though and apologized for the inconvenience. But it did not make up for the fact that it took another 20 minutes for a side of sweet potato fries. Come here when you have lots of time on your hands.
Service is way too slow. A coupon for a free item next time isn't enough to make up for the fact I waited 40 mins for my food. Same thing last time I was here. Spend your money elsewhere.

Although the food was good, the poor service totally ruins the dining experience.    When we arrived for dinner at 8:30 pm, the hostess was nowhere to be found.  Tired of waiting we decided to seat ourselves and while we were doing so, we  encountered a frowning less than polite hostess.The place was MORE than half empty.  A waitress stopped by the table, told us she was not really our waitress but she would take our order.  Once our food arrived, we NEVER saw her again.  Our drinks were empty and not once did one of the servers that walked by, or the hostess, stop to see if we needed anything.   After we were done eating (without anything to drink)....still no waitress...so we hit the call server button on  the tabletop device..  The hostess walked by our table 3 times with the red light blinking and did NOT stop.  At that point, I had to get up and walk to the bar area to find someone...anyone...that would give us our check.  I asked to speak to a manager.   Our 'not really our waitress' came over and said "no one's been here to check on you?".  Seriously??? And then she handed us our check.   We never did see a manager.... my guess is there is/was no manager, hence the horrible service.

Came here as a last minute dinner because it was raining heavily and besides our waiter our experience was horrible. Our waiters name was Janee she was a doll super sweet. However there was a young female employee in the back with braids and a nose ring was yelling and cussing up a storm and apparently from what I heard it was all over some French fries, and she continued to yell continually until we left the restaurant and we were there for about an hour, three different employees kept asking her to please quiet down  and to stop. It was hard to enjoy dinner with all that going on, not to mention my burger was very red when I asked for well done, my daughters Mac and cheese was ridiculously cold and watery. The fries were cold and my fiancés wings were under cooked. Defiantly will not be coming back, however I feel our waiter deserved a good review!

Long multiparty conversation with friends about this location. Even worse experience than I encountered and added to that incredibly poor attitude towards customers and nobody has ever been able to find a manager on site. Putting a one year watch on the front door being boarded over and frankly, I seriously doubt it will take that long. At this point, you have to blame district management for such a poor history at a high profile location.  Shame.

I have come here a few times and never have a good experience. I find the management to be very condescending when they speak to customers. And we never have a good waitress experience either. Very disappointing.

Worst place ever and that's just from the outside. Waited nearly TWENTY MINUTES to be seated in AN EMPTY RESTAURANT!!!!! And then the young blue haired woman for whom seating people was a huge challenge proceeded to be horribly rude, belligerent and condescending to my husband, myself and my daughter. I am usually a big fan of Red Robin, but I will never and suggest no one else ever, go to the Red Robin at the Danbury Mall. That woman and her supervisor should be fired instantly.

Awful awful awful!  The hostess kept saying she'd be back as she's inside cleaning off tables. after waiting enough time we went into the bar. The bartender was just as bad. "I'll be right with you" barely happened. The drinks took forever and were awful. Food so so. Don't waste your time. Plenty of better places on Mill plain rd to eat. We've eaten at this chain elsewhere; obviously these folks don't know what they are doing. They need someone who knows how to run a restaurant.

Food is okay every time I go with my girlfriend. She loves to come here but we both always leave with an upset stomach. The new macaroni burger was a good change probably one of the better because the chili burger I grabbed at the Danbury location was flavorless. Hopefully you guys get better with the food quality because prior to the last few times we didn't have any negative comments on the food and we eat at almost every location the macaroni burger was in Milford and it was good but her food made her stomach upset and she always orders the same. Maybe it's something silly but we've noticed something a little off.
LOVE the burgers. The people are so nice and genuine. I always come here on my lunch break and get a smoothie. It's so worth the weight gain, the food is delicious.

Sat at the bar for 5 minutes. Service was good at first. It was 1:25pm, ordered a small tortilla soup. I asked about it 20 minutes later; nothing.  It arrived at 1:56pm. The place was not crowded and the owner brought the soup. I had to walk out and left it there. Service was disappointing.
The burgers were over cooked and the bun was stale. What else ?  Service was nonexistent and it was overpriced

After a tiring shopping trip at the mall, attempted to fill one of the many empty seats at this restaurant. Host advised us of a 50 minute wait. WTF, help doesn't care about customers, I'm crossing this joint off my crappy food list. I can only guess mismanagement.
Some of the burgers are good some are down right nasty. It's ok I guess it is what it is. The service is hit or miss. It's a ok place for a beer and a burger.

Went to different time with two different people every time we ordered burgers and they were great, sometimes got a milkshake to go with the burger, and sweet potato fries, it was amazing, sometimes the line can get more, so it is best to tell them before you are hungry so when you are finished shopping since it is in the Danbury mall , you can be seated right away,  They even made it so you can pay your bill at your table, and dont have to wait for a server,  I will be back,  Thank you

Putting the word "gourmet" alongside Red Robin is a gross overstatement We had lunch at the Danbury Mall location on New Year's Day.  There was approximately 10 small groups waiting on line which appeared to overwhelm the host who took a long time seating people in a relatively empty restaurant  The server..... overly solicitous to the point of being annoying.   When we placed our order we were advised that rare burgers was not an option but they could be ordered with a little pink.  I changed my order but my wife proceeded with the burger which came out well-done and dry The server agreed about the burger being overcooked and called over the manager who agreed to recook the order but said it world take a long time.  He clearly did not want to replace it The next burger came out more over cooked than the first.  The waiter agreed and said it wasn't his fault and that he did all he could do Not the right answer!   We paid and left as it was not worth the fight BTW, I had the assorted fried fish.  Red Robin found a way to make fried cod tough We will never go back but will share our experience with anyone who asks
My Birthday Burger was awesome.  Thank you Red Robin Dipping sauces and beer were equally as good

I've given this place at least 10 chances. And it was 10 chances too many. It's consistently the same bad service since the day it opened.  Long story short, if you are planning on ordering over the phone FORGET IT! These people are never interested in having your business! You WILL be kept on hold for a minimum os 5-15minutes. (EVERY single time!) This is because they have this genius system where they want to get someone from the bar to take your take out order. Great system! As you know bartenders are really motivated to do something they probably aren't gonna get a tip for! So you'll wait for NO reason and it seems almost as if that they are doing it passively aggressively, out of spite.  So why am I officially done with this Danbury location? Girl comes on says "1hr. wait for orders." Wait....WHAT??? 1HR WAIT? I asked why. "We're really busy today!" Since when is that kind of wait time acceptable? It's as if she was saying that to make it sure I WOULDN'T order. Which I proceeded to do. That's a great way to send your customers elsewhere. Yes, I understand that it was a weekend day at lunchtime; but this was 3pm! Well AFTER lunchtime. 1HR wait at 3PM?? Unheard of!  You know, nobody can be having THAT much business and act like they don't need it! When I walk by on weekdays, that place is empty and dead as a doornail. So I hope the employees realize that in case if they find themselves out of a job because the place shut down, don't ask why! I won't feel sorry for them WHEN that happens (It really is just a question of "when". None of these restaurants survive at DFM.)  Here is the sad part: The quality of the food is actually outstanding! All credit goes to the kitchen at this place. But the service staff have to be kicked out! I have seen so many of the service staff behave in a similar manner. So this is not directed at any one person, it is consistent. It's safe to assume this is "the norm" around here and this behavior is allowed. And even acceptable! It is a clear indication that management is very very poor at this place.  This is not to say that the Red Robin experience is normally this way at all. I frequented a location in NJ for years. And been to other locations across the country. It's been a 5-star experience every single time. But this place? 1 star every time. And it shouldn't be this way because this place could truly dominate Danbury if it wanted to. Ask around and you will realize that there are many people that don't even realize this place exists!  Orders shouldn't be taken by the bar people anymore. OK fine, I understand that they rely on tips. Orders should be taken by the greeter or someone not being tipped do it. That's how it's usually done. That way they'll do it without expecting incentive or grumbling about it!  Corporate, you listening? See problems in the numbers? THIS is why! Spare the generic reply and really fix it!

Service was friendly but the food took over 30 mins and it wasn't even a busy night...our burgers were good but like warm by the time they arrived.Those bottomless fries were a joke...they give you live five of them at once then expect you to wait like 20 min for you to even see the waiter to ask for five more fries....HELL NO SCREW THAT.SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO TO 5 GUYS BURGERS...ITS WAAAYYY BETTER...BETTER PRICES BETTER SERVICE BETTER BACKROUND MUSIC.

There are better places to eat in the area.  The service is generally good though they often seem understaffed leading to longer wait times.  The food is just okay but I've been served rotting produce on more than one occasion.  Even when talking to the manager about it, his answer was that he'd talk to their vendor.  I'd prefer he talk to the people plating food since they're the ones putting rotting food on my plate.

Just left when patrons seated after our party were acknowledged, given drinks, and attended too by the waitress.  Meanwhile, we were not and the front staff were indifferent and inattentive.  We were ignored by the waitstaff even though several members were hovering and even by a member of management. Before we even got to the door, one member of our party noticed that the inattentive front hostess was clearing the menus from our table and no one stopped to inquire as to why we decided to leave.

Our server was Matt... what an amazing meal we had! The food was good but the service was amazing! He was so thoughtful of our wants and needs and helped us pick a burger! This guy needs a promotion!!!!!! ASAP!
Service was terrible!! Very slow!! Floor was filthy!! Food was ok, but very slow!! Probably won't go back. On a positive note: the manager discounted our bill which was very nice of him.

I live in Boston and go here with family frequently when I come to visit them. The prices are really reasonable and the burgers are pretty tasty. They have some really interesting burgers here like the Royal Red Robin with the egg, or the Burning Love with tons of jalapeños and sauce. The bottomless fries are also great, my favorite is the garlic fries, they are topped with garlic butter and tastes so much better! Its great they have tablets on every table so when you are ready to pay, you can do it via the tablet without the 2 extra round trips waiting for the check and waiting for the waiter to return your card.  My only complain is the lacking of staffing, this place is definitely understaff because even when its not busy, we normally have to wait quite a while to get service and get our food. When its busy (6:30-8), the wait times are even worse, and we sometimes need to wait 20+ minutes for our food to arrive. I wish they would hire more waiters here to improve wait times.

Stopped in for a quick bite after doing some shopping.  I ordered the Red Tavern double wrapped in lettuce and it was quite good.  The burger had good flavor and was very moist.  Substituted a salad on the side instead of "bottomless fries"  to complete this low carb meal.  Service was efficient and quick. This is a nice alternative to eating in the food court.
Waited too long to be seated. Lots of empty tables so we left. Would have appreciated a bit more information from the hostess.

So I had a free coupon from this joint it was the free birthday burger. I feel that the burger was excellnt I got the whiskey bbq burger with garlic fries and it was delivious it took no more then 15 minutes to make and I was extremely happy and satisfied I had to order at the bar because I didnt want to eat at the fine establishment. I forgot the chaps name but he was very accomadating in the transaction. The burger itself was delicious and the fries where yummmy. I will def be back to this place and order from here again. Thank you Red Robin for the burger! Don't listen to the haters the service was great and the wait time was superb if you wanted fast service you best go to magdonalds in the food court!!!!

Burgers are always good...service not so much. Waited over 5 minutes to be seated at an almost completely empty restaurant. Server took order and we didn't see her for twenty minutes. Nada nothing until she brought out the food (yep 20 minutes)

Not "gourmet"... think Buffalo Wild Wings but for burgers. I enjoyed the food all the same - the burger was done the way I like and it's nice the offer substitutes if you want to make a light meal, e.g., substitute salad instead of french fries. Service was decent too. I also liked how I could pay using the iPad at the table instead of waiting for the check. I would recommend this as a casual dining place.

I usually love Red Robin, but this location needs a complete overhaul. We visited on a Tuesday, right around lunch time (12:30pm). It wasn't packed, but steady with many open tables. It took awhile to get seated because the host was MIA. We were finally seated and then greeted by our waiter. We ordered onion rings to start which are always a favorite. They ran out of the Campfire sauce and said the kitchen was making more. Not a big deal but it does speak to the efficiency, or lack there of, in regards to the kitchens organization-a sign of what was to come. We received our food and to say I was disappointed is an understatement. I ordered the Whiskey BBQ burger and I've never seen a sadder display. The toppings were limp and less than fresh. My fries weren't cold, but they weren't hot either. Just meh. Now we come to the real issue and absolute ridiculousness of this restaurant. My sister ordered sweet potato fries with her order and they were ice cold. So, we naturally did what any normal consumer would do. We asked for new fries. Guess what they brought us? A basket of the same exact cold fries. The best part was that the waiter said, "Yeah, so I guess the sweet potato fries are coming out lukewarm today."  What?! I mean seriously, as a waiter I would have gone Gordon Ramsay on the cook and said "These fries are so cold, a goose down parka couldn't warm them up!"  What reason could the kitchen have for not making new fries? Is it really rocket science to lower the basket in the fryer and make your customers happy? From start to end this visit was terrible. Makes me question my entire love for Red Robin. I definitely won't be back to this location.

I hate to give it a 1 star review because the burgers are actually tasty but that's how bad the staff is here.  Our waitress was rude, incompetent, and downright stupid.  That's right Isabelle, I'm talking to you.  Sat down for a quick burger with my father and sister and explained we were going to take one to go for my girlfriend waiting at home.  Not wanting to wait around for it we tried to place the order to go when we were ordering our own food but she just wouldn't take it.  Another waitress brings out our food, minus my chipotle aioli of course, and still no sign of Isabelle.  We are basically finished with our meal and calling her on the tech device at the table before she saunters over to tell us she'd forgotten about taking the to go order.  Another 20 minutes of waiting and we were finally on our way.  Please, spare yourself the aggravation and do not go here.

I wish I had read the reviews before coming here in order to have spared myself. This has to have been the worst service I have ever received in my life.. not only was it slow, our waitress was also absent and rude. My party of 4 tried to write it off as "they do things slower in Connecticut" and we were just being fast paced New Yorkers - but when we received our cold food we almost lost it.  We all got a deal with our burgers for bottomless fries so we stayed just for them. They didn't necessarily fix our experience but it did help.  45 minutes is way too long of a wait for "FAST" food - GET IT TOGETHER RED ROBIN.

Would give "zero" stars but can't.  Have been coming here regularly and last night was by far the worst so much so that I will NEVER be back. We were asked if we wouldn't mind being seated in the lounge and when we got there we waited 10 min to be acknowledged, then another 45 min waiting for our food to which we watched the waitress talk to friends of hers and wondered if our food was sitting in the back getting cold.  She finally acknowledged us and checked on our food.  Watching her come from the kitchen she stopped again to talk to someone and someone else's  drink she was also carrying fell over on the tray and broke.  We watched her go to the bar and then comes over and says " I think there is glass in your salad, not sure about the hamburger". Umm were we to test it out??  She then says she would have to look through the salad.  Huh, now you will search the salad to see if there is glass.  We said "absolutely not" to which she ran to the back......saying nothing.  We walked up to the bar and said  "goodbye". To which we received no apology ... nothing !  he just just ran over to computer to cancel our order.  Unbelievable!!!!!!

Not my first or second choice to eat, but we were at the mall and my boys wanted burgers. The hostess sat us in the middle, because there was no other spot, even though there was lots of room in the back. Waitress was ok. But wanted us to order our app on the computer screen. Isn't that her job?  Food a little slow coming out. My chicken meal, looked nothing like the picture. It had so much blackening spice it was in eatable. Plus I asked for 1 piece of chicken not 2. But the kitchen manager saw me looking at the menu and asked me what was wrong and I told him. He offered to recook some new chicken and brought it out to me. Told me it came with 2 pieces even though menu showed option for 1. He really cared about his service and was walking around a quite bit. He also gave me his business card and coupon for free appetizer.

I thought back over as many bad restaurant experiences as I could remember, but I could not think of one bad experience that was even close to the level of Red Robin. It took 35 Minutes to get our drinks. At that point we asked if we could have our soup while we waited for the burgers. We were told they had to 'bake' the soup. Really? At 45 mins into the Red Robin nightmare, we told the waitress to cancel our order and bring us a check for our soft drinks. At 55 mins a man, presumably the manager, told us they were working on our order. Two cups of soup, and two burgers. He repeatedly tried to get us to stay, and eventually cancelled the bill for our two sodas. According to some of the serving staff, they also have to do the dishes on some days, and that explained why we had such a bad experience. That seems difficult to believe, but, who knows?  There were not a lot of diners in the restaurant. Perhaps this is not the norm there? If it was they would have long since closed the doors. This was so bad, I wouldn't even consider ever giving it another try. This is as our first time there, so we'll never know if the burgers were good. The soda was fine though.

Stopped in to grab a quick salad. Our waitress was very nice, but the venue clearly has no sense of urgency. Dirty tables everywhere. Looks like the hostess also clearing tables. Not a good impression when you first walk in.

I went to Red Robin with my boyfriend I was really hungry and we chose to go to Red Robin because I thought it would be filling. I ordered the Siracha Burger when I got the burger it was literally just hamburger, cheese, and a tiny bit of onion on a bun ..no siracha no spicy mayo no pickles no lettuce no tomatoes which were all supposed to be in the burger as it says in the menu. If they somehow were missing all those ingredients which is kind of hard to believe the waitress could have a least let me know instead of giving me a bland burger with basically nothing on it. I asked to at least have some siracha sauce to put in it since it's supposed to be a siracha burger and the waitress handed me a little container of powder ..I was like seriously... anyways even being extremely hungry I was able to force myself to eat half the burger but felt sick and grossed out to eat any more then that. Nevertheless the waitresses at Red Robin need to be trained to how to properly communicate with customers and at least try to be accommodating. I left still very hungry and very displeased will not be going back to this location.

I'm perplexed about the negative reviews for this location and I'm thinking I must have went to a different restaurant. Now, this place isn't gourmet dining, but you can go in and get a good deal for a decent price. I came in for lunch and ordered the Madlove burger, suggested by my server, Laura. While the food took a little extra time to come out. The food runner, immediately upon brining our my meal, asked about me needing anything else and quickly brought it out to me. My burger, with some pink, was perfectly cooked. The garlic fries were good, but I have had better. For the price, I feel like I had a good quality meal. However, as someone who loves sauce, I was disappointed that they charge per premium sauce. At the very least, the first one should be included. Don't nickel and dime honest customers, please! Overall, I had positive thoughts to share about this RR with others and next time I'm craving a burger, I'd come back.
